Articles.Content:
any chance this gets updated to 1.4.3 someday soon ? 

current version lets you add cams, but they do not respond

or am i doing something wrong?!

Edited May 8, 2018 by dxeh

16 hours ago, dxeh said:

any chance this gets updated to 1.4.3 someday soon ? 

current version lets you add cams, but they do not respond

or am i doing something wrong?!

Current version should work in 1.4.3.

log file, please

There are a lot of errors.

Note: The MovieTime and NightVision modes are currently not working.  This is known, please do not report as a bug

Are these meant?

Just to be sure it's them and not something else.

Actually, no, it's not that.  HullCamera is not used or needed, I'll remove it.  Same with the resource

On 5/8/2018 at 3:33 PM, dxeh said:

any chance this gets updated to 1.4.3 someday soon ? 

current version lets you add cams, but they do not respond

or am i doing something wrong?!

Are you using the minus (-) or equals sign (=) to switch the camera views?

New release, 0.1.9.3:

  • Added message to identify current camera when switching
  • Added two new config options, both defaulting to true:
    • DisplayCameraNameWhenSwitching
    • DisplayVesselNameWhenSwitching
  • Added new config option, defaulting to 3 seconds, allowable range is 1-10
    • MessageDuration
  • Commented out all old references to HullCamera and RESOURCE in the parts

Thank you!

Awesome!

3 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:

New release, 0.1.9.3:

  • Added message to identify current camera when switching
  • Added two new config options, both defaulting to true:
    • DisplayCameraNameWhenSwitching
    • DisplayVesselNameWhenSwitching
  • Added new config option, defaulting to 3 seconds, allowable range is 1-10
    • MessageDuration
  • Commented out all old references to HullCamera and RESOURCE in the parts

Awesome! Thank you!

your latest release works. so gues it just wasnt compatible at that time.. like the mod thnx

Thank you so much for all your hard work!!!

now this is cool i have a great idea im gonna make a rover cam and use this fmrs so i can record my take off

Something similar has probably been asked before, but would it be possible to make this mod render to an offscreen buffer whose contents can then be broadcast instead of drawing it onscreen?

Edited July 1, 2018 by c4ooo

11 minutes ago, c4ooo said:

Something similar has probably been asked before, but would it be possible to make this mod render to an offscreen buffer whose contents can then be broadcast instead of drawing it onscreen?

No idea.  I suppose it might be possible, but I have no idea how.

28 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

No idea.  I suppose it might be possible, but I have no idea how.

That's unfortunate. I guess I could write a program to screencapture KSP and read the correct pixels, but that is not a  clean solution considering the camera output is still going to take up the game window. I am not above trying to programming this sort of functionality when I get the time, but unfortunately I really don't understand how this mod works considering that the most I have ever contributed to a KSP plugin is around 20 lines of code and that I have no Unity experience
@linuxgurugamer where is the "camera" located on the docking port jr? I have some very minor part clipping at the edges of the port, but the camera is still obstructed in flight.
The center, I believe

1 hour ago, linuxgurugamer said:

The center, I believe

That's what I figured. I removed the lights and drogues to no avail, then I moved the port itself up a little and the issue went away—the part underneath the port was clipping into the camera.

If you ever find yourself messing around with the docking ports in unity, could you consider moving the camera a little further forward so that it's closer to the docking port face? I'm assuming the camera is just attached to the CoM of the part.

47 minutes ago, blorgon said:

That's what I figured. I removed the lights and drogues to no avail, then I moved the port itself up a little and the issue went away—the part underneath the port was clipping into the camera.

If you ever find yourself messing around with the docking ports in unity, could you consider moving the camera a little further forward so that it's closer to the docking port face? I'm assuming the camera is just attached to the CoM of the part.

You can adjust it yourself.

In the HullCameraVDS folder, there is a file called: DockingPortCameraPatch.cfg

Find the section which looks like this: 

@PART[dockingPort3]
{
	MODULE
	{
	    name = MuMechModuleHullCameraZoom
	    cameraName = NavCam
	    cameraForward = 0, 1, 0
	    cameraUp = 0, 0, -1
	    cameraPosition = 0, 0.0, 0
	    cameraFoVMax = 60
	    cameraFoVMin = 60
	    cameraMode = 1
	
	}
}

The line you want to adjust is cameraPosition

and, i would suspect that the middle number needs to be adjusted just a bit.

1 hour ago, linuxgurugamer said:

You can adjust it yourself.

In the HullCameraVDS folder, there is a file called: DockingPortCameraPatch.cfg

Find the section which looks like this: 


@PART[dockingPort3]
{
	MODULE
	{
	    name = MuMechModuleHullCameraZoom
	    cameraName = NavCam
	    cameraForward = 0, 1, 0
	    cameraUp = 0, 0, -1
	    cameraPosition = 0, 0.0, 0
	    cameraFoVMax = 60
	    cameraFoVMin = 60
	    cameraMode = 1
	
	}
}

The line you want to adjust is cameraPosition

and, i would suspect that the middle number needs to be adjusted just a bit.

Oh, sweet. I figured adding cameras to parts was a Unity thing. Thanks!

New release, 0.1.9.4

  • Fixed error: Texture 'HullCameraVDS/Parts/hc_wideangle/model000' not found
  • Fixed missing texture for the wideangle camera

New release, 0.1.9.5

  • fixed RPM patch for showing camera fov in the editor for the Kazzelblad and wide-angle camera
